GA4GHclient
  • Reference
  • Articles

GA4GHclient

Installing required packages. On R:

source("https://bioconductor.org/biocLite.R")
useDevel()
biocLite(c("AnnotationDbi", "BiocGenerics", "Biostrings", "dplyr", "DT",
    "GenomeInfoDb", "GenomicFeatures","GenomicRanges", "httr", "IRanges",
    "jsonlite", "knitr", "S4Vectors", "shiny", "shinydashboard",
    "shinyjs", "VariantAnnotation"))

Install annotation packages for Human Genome:

biocLite(c("org.Hs.eg.db", "TxDb.Hsapiens.UCSC.hg19.knownGene"))

Install GA4GHclient package from GitHub (development version).

biocLite("devtools")
library(devtools)
install_github("labbcb/GA4GHclient")

GA4GHclient package has three vignettes:

“GA4GHclient” vignette:

vignette("GA4GHclient")

Load and use GA4GH package.

There are three available data servers that use GA4GH API. If you known more public data servers compatible with GA4GH API please let us know.

  • Hosting Thousand Genomes Project
  • Ensembl REST API
  • BRCA Exchange GA4GH API: http://brcaexchange.org/backend/data/ga4gh/v0.6.0a7/

The app function start a web interface connected to one data server.

library(GA4GHclient)
app("http://1kgenomes.ga4gh.org/", orgDb = "org.Hs.eg.db", txDb = "TxDb.Hsapiens.UCSC.hg19.knownGene")
